explains: n. （个人独有的）气质，性格，习惯，癖好

sentences.en: This Jam idiosyncrasy is necessary to preserve the soundness of the type system.
sentences.cn: 这个jam特性是保护类型系统的稳固性所必不可少的。

sentences.en: Perhaps the intense loyalty that these firms inspire is just an interesting idiosyncrasy.
sentences.cn: 也许这些公司所激发的强烈的忠诚感只是一种有趣的癖好。

sentences.en: Each doctor may have an idiosyncrasy or two - a pronunciation issue or unknown idiom - which may require a transcriptionist to ask a question or two.
sentences.cn: 每个医生都有一两个独特的风格——发音问题或未知的习语——这就使转录员需要提出一两个问题。
